title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 653.2 - Interest and penalties on underpayment of taxes in counties within the City of New York
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 653.2 - Interest and penalties on underpayment of taxes in counties within the City of New York

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 258(2)
(a) In cases where a mortgage has been
recorded without payment of the appropriate taxes described in Part 642 of this

Title, and to the extent the mortgage covers real property located in the City
of New York, interest shall be imposed and computed upon the unpaid balance of
taxes due. The rate of interest to be imposed on the taxes remaining unpaid
shall be the rate of interest prescribed pursuant to section 1096(e) of article
27 of the Tax Law for underpayments of tax. Such interest shall be compounded
daily. (b) In addition to the
interest described in subdivision (a) of this section, in cases where it could
not be determined from the face of an instrument that mortgage recording taxes
were due, or where an advance has been made on a trust mortgage or a re-advance
has been made on a mortgage where the original indebtedness has been paid in
whole or in part and taxes remain unpaid, and to the extent the mortgage covers
real property located in the City of New York, there shall be imposed a penalty
at the rate of 10 percent of the amount of taxes due for the first month of
delay in payment of the taxes plus two percent of the amount of taxes due for
each month of delay thereafter, up to a maximum of 25 percent. (c) In cases where a mortgage of real
property subject to the taxes described in Part 642 of this Title has been
recorded or is hereafter recorded in good faith, and the recording officer has
held such mortgage nontaxable or taxable at one amount, and it is later
determined by the commissioner that it is taxable or taxable at a greater
amount, the commissioner may cancel the penalties described in subdivision (b)
of this section but not the interest. Notes
